actions.committee: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committees.committee: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

official_title: A bill to provide funding to improve the security of the American people by protecting against the threat of bioterrorism.
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services

summary.text: Provides funding under the 2001 Emergency Supplemental Appropriations Act for Recovery from and Response to Terrorist Attacks on the United States for specified Federal agencies and programs to improve the U.S. response to bioterrorism, including funds for : (1) the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention for multiple programs; (2) grants to hospitals; (3) smallpox vaccine purchase and administration; (4) National Institutes of Health laboratory security; (5) disaster response teams within the Department of Health and Human Services; (6) National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases; (7) the National Pharmaceutical Stockpile; (8) training for workplace bioterrorism response; (9) the Food and Drug Administration for food safety inspection capacity; and (10) the Department of Agriculture for food safety inspection and research facility upgrade.

titles.title: A bill to provide funding to improve the security of the American people by protecting against the threat of bioterrorism.
